full_summary:
**Notice of Request for Standing Offer**

*Title*: Production, Printing, and Installation of Event-related Signage and Exhibits

*Reference Number*: PW-22-01015160

**Request for Standing Offer Overview**
The Department of Canadian Heritage (PCH) is inviting printing and sign-making suppliers to submit offers for the production, printing, and installation of exhibit signage and decors required to mount national events. This Request for Standing Offer (RFSO) invites suppliers to provide the full range of professional services involved in:

* Producing and printing of exhibit signage and decors;
* Installation of signage and decors; and
* Providing standard graphic layouts or templates to facilitate the application of text in various formats used.

**Evaluation Criteria**
The evaluation of offers will be based on the following mandatory criteria:

1. **Experience and Capacity of the Company:**
Supplier must demonstrate two (2) separate contracts with external customers for the fabrication, printing, and installation of signage products similar in scope.
2. **Ability to Accept and Produce Signage from Electronic Files:**
Supplier must confirm the availability of a FTP site to receive electronic files from customers and the ability to format and print files using Adobe Acrobat Pro DC or equivalent.
3. **Material and Equivalent Products:**
Supplier must provide specifications and descriptive literature for each proposed equivalent product in accordance with the requirements described in the RFSO.

**Important Dates**

* Tender Closing Date: January 16, 2023 at 14:00:00 EST
* Amendment Date: January 5, 2023

**Contact Information**

* Contact Person: Barry, Housseynatou
* Contact Email: [housseynatou.barry@pch.gc.ca](mailto:housseynatou.barry@pch.gc.ca)
* Contact Phone: 000-000-0000

**Notice Attachments**
Refer to the following attachments for additional information:
* Equivalent Material Specs
* RFSO Document
* Question-Response 1 and 2
* Basis of Payment
* Appendices B.1, B.2, and B.3

Note: The Crown retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement. Documents may be submitted in either official language.  [1](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/12/06/e46b78539c03ff6776cab28aa6d61b6a/10211455_appendice_b.1.pdf)
